channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 5 Reasons You Should Still Learn To Code
item.description: A recent AI Daily Brief podcast took on the question based on a lot of industry debate.

item.title: Amazon Drops iPhone 16 Price In Rare New Apple Sale
item.description: Amazon has slashed the price of the Apple iPhone 16 for its Spring sale.

item.title: Hero Forge Expands Into Custom Dice For Dungeons And Dragons Players
item.description: Hero Forge expands its custom accessory options to include custom dice. Backing the Kickstarter gives fans a chance to be the first at the table to ha...

item.title: Google’s Best Gemini AI Chatbot Is Now Free To Use — But There’s A Catch
item.description: Google Gemini 2.5 Pro Experimental is free to use, but only paying Gemini Advanced users can access its full power with Canvas.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy Watch 8 Plans: No Ultra 2 But Classic Returns In 2025?
item.description: Six watch models have been referenced in a Samsung test firmware package, offering clues as to what's coming in the Samsung Galaxy Watch 8 range.

item.title: Division is easier than connection
item.description: But connection is where the value lies. Connected, resilient communities create possibility and forward motion. Division is satisfying in the short ru...

item.title: “Be yourself”
item.description: Really? Which self? The self you were when you were two years old, almost out of diapers? The self you were when you were screaming with the fans at t...

item.title: Toward leggiero
item.description: We might not seek it out often enough in our work. It’s a musical term, but we can use it too. The light touch. A way to make a sound without making a...

item.title: Obvious vs perhaps
item.description: “Obvious” closes the door to inquiry. “Perhaps” opens it.

item.title: The name doesn’t matter (that much)
item.description: Busy people in important organizations waste a lot of time naming things. It could be that once a name is good enough, you’re done. That’s certainly t...
